::REDHOT::

    The seeker closed his eyes, absorbed in Firedrill's tale, vividly 
imagining the story as the Autobot told it. The story was 
FANTASTIC..... He had several questions he wanted to ask, but he 
didn't want to interrupt.

Northlight
Domnijoe Productions
*********************

> Firedrill was lost in the momment now, his eyes were filled with
> emotion, as we went on.
> 
> 
______________________________________________________________________
*****Flashback*****
> 
> "When a spark goes online, there is great Joy. When a Cybertronian 
gets
> to make his choice, it makes all those millenia of fighting, worth 
it."
> 
>  The thoughts rolled through his head. The light in the middle of 
the
> room showcased his ideas. Perceptor looked up from his work, in 
front of
> him were four Autobot shells newly created where to be implanted 
with
> sparks. It was a time for great joy, as this would signal the first
> online of an Autobot, who did not need to ingage in war, if they did 
not
> want to. The creation Matrix had been brought out of the main 
security
> system for this joyous ocation. Even though Optimus Prime had died
> fighting Galvatron, his dream for peace, and a new breed of Sentient
> Autobots was to live on. Perceptor turned to look around, Ironhide, 
whom
> the matrix had recently brought back to life, along with Prowl, the
> Protectobots and Red Alert had brought it in safely. Although they 
were
> in an era of peace, there were still small bands of Decepticons on 
the
> loose, and the lose of the Matrix could mean the restart of the 
great
> war. Perceptor had a sigh of relief, as the dreaded thought left his
> mind, Motormaster had been put behind bars. Shockwave had disapeared 
for
> a very long time, Scorponok was disabled, Starscreams' ghost gone, 
and
> Megatron. Perceptor shuddered. One creature, would always be known, 
for
> restarting, the great war, and invigorating the Decepticons, into a 
new
> age of violence and destruction. All of that was hopefully behind 
them. 
> 
> He turned to the rest of his staff. First Aid, Grappled and Hoist 
had
> all helped create bodies for these new Autobots, and they were 
anxious
> to see them at work, and many of the other Autobots were simply here
> because this was something they fought for. Except Grimlock, 
Perceptor
> was right, he would have problems adapting to a life without 
conflict,
> as the massive warrior leaned against a wall alone, brooding. 
Perceptor
> shook his head, and addressed the Autobots.
> 
> "Fellow Autobots, today is a speacial day, where Optimus Prime's 
dream
> will be realised." Perceptor said joyfully. Bumbelbee and Gears 
looked
> up, suprisingly enough Gears had a smile on his face, that is until 
Jazz
> and Cliffjumper screeched into the lab, both transforming. He turned 
his
> head. 
> 
> "Your late." he whispered, but spat the words like a knife. Jazz 
could
> only smile, about to laugh, but Cliffjumper shot back a nasty look, 
and
> pushed his way forward. Perceptor continued.
> 
> "Today, four Autobots will come on line, and will be given the 
choice,
> of weither or not to join the diminished Autobot army. This will be 
a
> first in over 20 million years." Perceptor gleamed. He was going to 
make
> Scientific history. 
> 
> "Ahhh, quit talking and get this show on the road." Ironhide 
bursted,
> hardly able to hold down his anticipation.
> 
> Perceptor frowned, but quickly began to smile again, this day could 
not
> be ruined. "Then if First Aid will assist me." Perceptor asked, as 
he
> jumped up, transforming and shrinking into his Microscope mode, 
landing
> on a platform just above one of the Autobots heads. First Aid 
planted a
> small chip in the Microscope, and it Perceptor implanted it in the 
first
> robot. The robots eyes opened, and Perceptor beamed again. 
"Autobots,
> meet Flask." he said, as the newly born Autobot looked around
> hesitantly. The large sea of face was a little overwhelming, but 
soon
> enough, the smiles on Autobot veterans made him feel at ease. 
> 
> "H..High everyone." he said smilling sheepishly. The platform 
Perceptor
> was on came to life, and shifted to the next Autobot shell, a much
> smaller robot, as the precedure was duplicated. "Meet, Crossroads."
> Perceptor chimed again, as Crossroads simply looked the crowd over, 
then
> looked like he was taking it all in, and analyzing the data.
> 
> Cliffjumper nudged Ironhide, "I wish Prime could see this." he said, 
as
> Ironhide added, 
> 
> "Yeahhh, this would have made him bust." Ironhide said, with 
fondness in
> his voice. "I wonder what these two will choose to do with their 
lives."
> T
